intro: Mattfeldanthus andrade-limae, commonly known as the Andrade-Limae cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowers are often vibrant in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
